Title: A Call for Reason, Justice, and National Interest: Why confirmation of Ambassador Ayodele Oke is imperative
Summary: President Bola Ahmed Tinubu has put forward a list of three non-career ambassadorial nominees . The nomination of Ambassador Ayodele Oke is imperative .

Title: Zirkzee ends goal drought as Man Utd come from behind to beat Palace 2-1
Summary: Joshua Zirkzee ends goal drought as Man Utd come from behind to beat Palace 2-1 . Mason Mount grabbed the winner for the Red Devils .

Title: Police recover N23m in lost gold coins in Borno border community
Summary: Borno State Police Command has recovered N23 million worth of lost gold coins at Malam Fatori in Abadam Local Government . According to police officers deployed to the border community police outpost with Niger, the gold coins remained intact .

Title: Gunmen kidnap C&S pastor, wife, church members in Kogi
Summary: Pastor of Cherubim and Seraphim in Ejiba community of Yagba West Local Government Area of Kogi State . The armed men attacked the church while worshippers were at the time .

Title: Rice farmers expect further drop in prices
Summary: Some farmers’ associations in Lagos State have predicted a further drop in the price of rice ahead of the yuletide . Some farmers' associations predict further drops in prices of rice .

Title: 10 African countries affected as Trump orders Green Card review [Full List]
Summary: At least ten African countries have been thrown into uncertainty after President Donald Trump ordered an immediate review of U.S. Green Card vetting procedures . The review follows a security incident involving members of the D.C. National Guard .

Title: Niger abduction: Bishop confirms four siblings among missing 265 students
Summary: Bishop of Kontagora Diocese, Most Rev. Bulus Dauwa Yohanna, confirms four siblings among missing 265 students . Four children belonging to one of the diocesan catechists remain among the missing victims .

Title: Delayed trials weaken public trust, undermine rule of law –  Gov Yusuf
Summary: Governor of Kano State, Abba Yusuf, has bemoaned the mounting cases of awaiting trial inmates in the country . He warned that delayed trials weaken public trust and undermine the rule of law .

Title: Bakare to Tinubu: Be courageous to tackle insecurity, reconcile Nigerians
Summary: Overseer of the Citadel Global Community Church, CGCC, Pastor Tunde Bakare, challenged President Bola Tinubu to stop playing ostrich and tackle the insecurity challenges facing the country . Bakare: Be courageous to tackle insecurity, reconcile Nigerians .

Title: Security challenges: Shettima, Kila seek robust national intelligence framework
Summary: Shettima, Kila seek robust national intelligence framework . The convener said by leveraging technology, security agencies could enhance their operational efficiency . He said it was difficult for criminal elements to operate undetected .

Title: Stop bandit attacks in Kano, Barau urges Security agencies
Summary: Deputy Senate President Barau Jibrin urges security agencies to intensify operations in Kano State . The call comes amid renewed pressure on security forces across the North . Communities in Kaduna, Katsina, Zamfara, and Niger states have faced repeated assaults by fleeing insurgents .

Title: Police probe viral video of officer's assault on bus conductor
Summary: Lagos State Police Command says it has launched an investigation into a police officer captured in a viral video while attempting to arrest a bus conductor in the Ikorodu area of the state . The officer appears to hold the conductor’s groin area tightly, while passengers intervene, shouting pleas like “Leave this boy” and

Title: Ndume hails troops for rescuing 12 abducted Borno girls
Summary: Former Senate Leader and lawmaker representing Borno South, Senator Ali Ndume, has commended the Nigerian Army for rescuing 12 teenage girls abducted by Boko Haram/ISWAP fighters . The girls, aged 15 to 20, were kidnapped a week ago while working on their family farms in Mussa District of Askira/Uba,

Title: Police arrest one, hunt killer of Delta retired justice
Summary: The Delta State Police Command has arrested one Lucky Matthew and launched a manhunt over the killing of retired Justice Ifeoma Okogwu . The Police Spokesperson for the Delta State Command, SP Bright Edafe, disclosed this in a statement released on Sunday in Asaba, the state capital .

Title: Atiku slams FG over ₦17.5tn pipeline security spending
Summary: Former Vice President Atiku Abubakar has criticised the Bola Tinubu administration over reports that the Nigerian National Petroleum Company Limited spent ₦17.5 trillion in one year on securing fuel pipelines . Atiku described the revelation as one of the most brazen financial scandals in Nigeria's history .
